events.name: iOS Dev Scout June Meetup
events.description: Speakers: • Yeo Kheng Meng  • 2nd Speaker: TBD  Agenda: • 6:30pm: Come, have pizza, say hello to each other • 7:10pm: Kheng Meng will talk about "Intro to Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) on Arduino and iOS"   • 7:40pm: 2nd Tech Talk - TBD • 8:10pm: Show & Tell (if any) • 8:20pm: Swift Quiz (yes it's back. Didn't get a chance to do it last couple of times)  About the Topics: • BLE is emerging wireless protocol generally used for low-power point-to-point communication, useful for IoT devices. BLE is useful when devices have to simply communicate without the hassle of setting up access points, DHCP, face IP addressing issues or Apple MFI licensing costs. This talk will demo live examples and coding demos on Arduino and iOS. Sponsors:  Dinner is kindly sponsored by https://hired.com  Refer a participating candidate or employer on Hired and score yourself a S$300 travel voucher!
events.location: PayPal 7th Floor, 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Singapore

events.name: The Intersection of UX and Tech
events.description: In today’s digital economy, user experience has the power to make or break a brand. While a flashy, user-facing solution might seem like a great idea, an outdated or inefficient back-end can trickle down into a subpar experience that even the best design can’t fix. Focusing only on the parts of an experience users can see and interact with can cost more in the long-term.  Join Associate UX Director Julie Kondo as she shares why investing in technology is as much a step toward good UX as creating a beautiful design. There will be snacks and drinks! Location: Huge's office is located at 33 Ann Siang Rd., Suite 31A. When you arrive, please check in with staff at the building entrance.  About the Speaker Julie Kondo, Associate UX Director at Huge As a UX designer, Julie Kondo’s job is to help brands build digital products their customers will love. Specializing in service design, Julie has worked with large-scale international companies including Google, P&G and Toyota to build experiences that reach millions of customers daily. For the past four years, Julie has worked at digital agency Huge, where she’s done stints in their New York, Los Angeles and Singapore offices. She is currently based in Singapore, where she leads the UX on one of the agency’s largest accounts and helps grow Huge’s UX talent in the region. Prior to joining Huge, Julie was a Product Developer at Nickelodeon, where she focused on designing mobile apps and building prototypes.
events.location: Huge Singapore, 33 Ann Siang Rd, Suite 31A

events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter - June 2016 Meetup
events.description: Dear All, Its meet up time again at Singapore SQL PASS Chapter.  Please refer below for the details. Agenda: June 23rd - 6:45 PM to 7 PM - Registration and Snacks 7 PM to 8 PM - Topic 1 - Presentation by Dharmendra Keshari 8:00 PM to 8:15 - Break 8:15 PM to 9:15 - Topic 2 - Presentation by Sarbjit Singh Gill Location: Microsoft Office, One Marina Boulevard, Conf Room SINOMB 22CF-15 Topic 1: SQL Server - Extended Events – Part1 Synopsis: Extended Event is a new method of collecting diagnostic data from SQL Server in a way that you could never get detailed information before using the previous features available. The presentation will talk about; how easily you can replace your existing SQL Trace file with extended events, why SQL Trace need be replaced. It will include in-depth two detailed demos Speaker Profile: Dharmendra Keshari Dharmendra Keshari has strong and in-depth experience in Database Management and its internals. Currently, working as Senior Database Administrator in one of the best organization in Singapore. He is an avid, regular mentor on social media, helping several enthusiast in solving problems related to Database management. He has completed certification for “Microsoft SQL Server® 2008, Implementation” and “Maintenance & Administering Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Database” Topic 2:  Integrating SQL data into web platform such as SharePoint. Synopsis: The topic will discuss on what are the possibilities of making your data available to users via a platform such as SharePoint (both SharePoint Online and on-premises). The idea behind this is to be able to take data out, run thru a business process system and integrate with other data.It is useful for a SQL DBA to understand how his/her data will be used. This is just one of the methods of this data is used. Speaker Profile: Sarbjit Singh Gill I bring 24 years of IT experience spanning consulting, architecture and training for Microsoft technologies such as Lync, Exchange, SQL Server, SharePoint, Windows Server, Active Directory, System Center range of products. I am also experienced in carrying out a Microsoft IO (Infrastructure Optimization) and Implementation of the MS MOF (Microsoft Operations Framework). Since 2005, I have been a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) with Technical Expertise in Lync, SCOM and SharePoint. I have participated as a speaker and proctor in numerous conference and forums and co-authored a book on MS Exchange monitoring using SCOM. As a MVP, I am founder of Singapore Lync User Group and an active member of other MS Technologies User Group communities.  I hold a FIA International "C" racing license and I race actively in Japan and Malaysia in touring cars endurance and club races. I am an active Scuba Diver with interest in underwater videography.
events.location: Microsoft Operations Pte Ltd, 22CF15, Level 22, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore

events.name: PCFDev and microservices configuration
events.description: We will meet at 7PM. Pizzas and beers provided and our talks will start at 7.30PM.  Talk 1: The power of Cloud Foundry on your laptop (Dapeng Liu) PCF Dev is a distribution of Cloud Foundry designed to run on a developer’s laptop or workstation. It gives application developers the full Cloud Foundry experience in a lightweight, easy to install package. It  is also intended for application developers who wish to develop and debug their application locally on a full-featured Cloud Foundry.  PCF Dev is also an excellent getting started environment for developers interested in learning and exploring Cloud Foundry. In this presentation Liu Dapeng will provide a step-by-step installation and setup of PCFDev, in addition to run demos that shows the nice features of PCFDev.  Talk 2: configuring your microservices (Stephan February) According to the Third Principal of Twelve Factor Applications, we should store our configuration in the environment. This is especially useful in a microservices architecture where you can have dozens of small applications that need to be configured. Stephan February will be presenting a talk on how to use the Config Server facility in Pivotal CloudFoundry to achieve an externalised, cloud-based application configuration.  Stephan February is a Software Engineer at Pivotal Labs Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late: Strokes
events.description:
Strokes
Thursday, June 23, 8pm
Expression Gallery, Level 4
Free admission. Register in the Lobby.

Become untethered as Dharma, George Chua, Brian O' Reilly and CHOWK collide in an experimental audio visual dialogue. Improvised movements, moving images and discordant sounds will take on a life of their own, traversing the space and morphing into formless remnants. Unexpect the expected : ArtScienceLate
